subject: Programming
title: Operating Systems as Managers
description: A micro-lesson that makes Operating Systems as Managers usable.

hook.text: Without an OS, every program would need to know how to talk to your specific keyboard and screen.

buildup.text: The operating system manages hardware so applications don't have to. It handles files, memory, and devices.

discovery.text: It decides which program gets CPU time, preventing any single app from hogging the processor.

twist.text: A bug in the OS can crash every program at once. The gatekeeper's failure takes down everything.

climax.text: Windows, macOS, Linux, and Android all do the same job: hide hardware from software.

punchline.text: The OS is the translator between apps and hardware.

quiz.question: What is the primary role of an operating system?
